newsitem.title: USA: UAW local union at Alcoa unit goes on strike.
newsitem.headline: UAW local union at Alcoa unit goes on strike.

text.p: More than 1,000 union workers have gone on strike at a Cleveland unit of Aluminum Co of America (Alcoa) after negotiations failed to reach a new labor contract, the unit said Thursday.

Cleveland Works, which makes forged aluminum truck wheels and forged aluminum components for the aerospace industry, said workers went on strike Wednesday after their local within the United Automobile Workers (UAW) did not ratify its final contract proposal.
No new talks are scheduled with Local 1050, which represents 1,100 workers, it said.
Alcoa and UAW had extended until September 4 the existing three-year contract after failing to reach an agreement last week.
